Detailed Description

This is the base class providing the accessory information and setting up any particular capabilities such as volume level in case of bluetooth handsfree.

Note:
In the current concept an accessory is also considered as being the default phone configuration (earpiece/handset mic), in other words any audio path configuration is considered as being an accessory.
accessory registration The customization of the accessory is done per each project and can be seen in the AudioAccessoriesRegistration.cpp file. The creation of the accessory objects is done in the AudioAccessoryStore during power on. The order of creation is very important since the priority is assigned in the order of adding to the list,the first accessory having the higher priority

 AddItem(AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryCfgBluetoothHandsfree,
         AudioPath::UplinkPathI2S1_Rx,
         AudioPath::DownlinkPathI2S1_Tx,
         FALSE,
         AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryCfgHeadset | AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryCfgStereoPhones,
         Tr(L"Bluetooth Handsfree"));

 AddItem(AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryCfgNormal,
         AudioPath::UplinkPathHandsetMic,
         AudioPath::DownlinkPathEarpiece,
         TRUE, // this "accessory" always exists in the system
         0, //Does not work in any other combination
         Tr(L"Normal"));

In the above example the BT handsfree accessory has higher priority

accessory handling Once the accessory objects are created any application can enable/disable then. 

 //Get the bluetooth handsfree accessory
 AudioAccessoryDetails* accessory = AudioAccessoryStore::GetInstance()->GetAccessoryByCfgType(AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryCfgBluetoothHandsfree);

 //Enable the accessory (the BT device has been already conected, here the audio paths are set up)
 accessory->SetConnected(TRUE);

typedef UINT32 AudioAccessoryDetails::ConnectedAccessoriesType
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryConfigurationType
 

Audio Accessory configuration type.

Enumerator:
AudioAccessoryCfgNormal  Normal, handset microphone/earpiece Use this variant of the "normal" accessory for the "available" column in the lookup table; In the "desired" column, use this variant for voice call
AudioAccessoryCfgHeadset  Headset, headset microphone/mono headset.
AudioAccessoryCfgStereoPhones  Stereo phones, headset microphone/stereo headset.
AudioAccessoryCfgBackspeaker_NormalMic  backspeacker, handset microphone/backspeacker Use this variant of the "backspeaker" accessory for the "available" column in the lookup table; In the "desired" column, use this variant for voice call
AudioAccessoryCfgBluetoothHeadset  Bluetooth headset, I2S1 rx/I2S1 tx.
AudioAccessoryCfgBluetoothHandsfree  Bluetooth handsfree, I2S1 rx/I2S1 tx.
AudioAccessoryCfgTTY  CTM/TTY, tty uplink/tty downlink, Available on SGOLD platforms only.
AudioAccessoryCfgCarKit  Car kit.
AudioAccessoryCfgBluetoothHeadsetRinger  Bluetooth Headset - Direct Audio playing ringtone.
AudioAccessoryCfgExtRingerHeadset  External ringer - Headset, headset microphone/mono headset.
AudioAccessoryCfgExtRingerStereoPhones  External ringer - Stereo phones, stereo headset.
AudioAccessoryCfgExtRingerBackspeaker  External ringer - BackSpeaker.
AudioAccessoryCfgRecordingNormal  Use this variant of the "normal" accessory only for the "desired" column of the lookup table, for the recording use cases (path control mode RecordingMode)
AudioAccessoryCfgRecordingBackspeaker  Use this variant of the "backspeaker" accessory only for the "desired" column of the lookup table, for the recording use cases (path control mode RecordingMode)
AudioAccessoryCfgUserDefined1  User defined.
AudioAccessoryCfgUserDefined2

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryDetails (  const AudioAccessoryConfigurationType  configuration,
const AudioPath &  uplink,
const AudioPath &  downlink,
BOOLEAN  active,
const UINT  compat_setting,
const WString &  type_name,
const WString &  actual_name = ""
) 
 

Parameters:
configuration The configuration type
uplink The uplink path to be used for this configuration
downlink The downlink path to be used for this configuration
active Indicates whether at the power up the accessory is already active/present or not
compat_setting The compatibility information indicating with what accessory AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryConfigurationType can be active at the same time. It can be also a combination of more than one accessory. Ex: AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryCfgHeadset | AudioAccessoryDetails::AudioAccessoryCfgCarKit
type_name The name of the accessory. For instance, "Bluetooth Headset"
actual_name The name of the actual accessory. For instance, "Bob's office Bluetooth Headset".

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN AudioAccessoryDetails::CanActivateAudioPaths (   )  const
 

Check whether in case of connection the AudioPathManager will activate the accessory's audio paths. It is dependent of the priority of the accessory. If an accessory with higher priority is already active and its compatibility settings do not match with the ones of the current one, then SetConnected() will not have any efect with regards to audio paths, the audio paths will not be set up due to priority conflict

Returns:
TRUE if no priority conflict
Note:
TBD, in the future this function should also check for HW resource conflicts

void AudioAccessoryDetails::EnableEcNr (  BOOLEAN  ecnr  )  [inline]
 

Enable or disable Echo Cancelation and Noise Reduction when the accessory is connected.

BOOLEAN AudioAccessoryDetails::GetUpdatePath (   )  const
 

Return the status of the audio path update flag that indicates whether the audio path has to be updated once the accessory is being connected using SetConnected() function

Returns:
TRUE if audio paths will be setup after the connection

Check if Echo Cancelation and Noise Reduction is enabled for this accessory.

void AudioAccessoryDetails::SetActualName (  const WString &  actual_name  ) 
 

See GetActualName().

void AudioAccessoryDetails::SetConnected (  BOOLEAN  connected,
BOOLEAN  update_path = TRUE
) 
 

Activate the accessory from the audio point of view. Once this function is called the audio path configuration will be updated considering also the compatible configurations specified through the constructor

Parameters:
connected TRUE if has to be connected
update_path TRUE if AudioPathManager has to add/remove the audio paths coresponding to this accessory FALSE, audio path will not be added.removed. This will be used for instance in case of TTY or BT accessories.
Note:
It is not enough to update_path as being TRUE to have the audio paths connected, there should not be a priority conflict as well, CanSetupAudioPaths()

void AudioAccessoryDetails::SetConnectedOld (  BOOLEAN  connected,
BOOLEAN  update_path = TRUE,
AudioDeviceBase::AudioSourceType  audio_source = AudioDeviceBase::DspAudioSource
) 
 

void AudioAccessoryDetails::SetVolume (  AudioDeviceBase::VolumeLevel  val  )  [virtual]
 

Set volume level in percentages.

void AudioAccessoryDetails::TurnVolume (  BOOLEAN  turn_up  )  [virtual]
 

Turn the volume level up or down

Parameters:
turn_up TRUE if volume has to be increasead

void AudioAccessoryDetails::UpdateConfiguration (   ) 
 

Called by audio path manager before linking the accessory to update the audio path setting in case of runtime configurable audio paths, ex TTY can have different sets of audio paths depending on some MMI settings
